form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: APPLICATION FOR STATUS AS PERMANENT RESIDENT, I-485 ( (Rev. 5-5-83) N

full_text: U.S. Department of Justice Screened by NARA, 8/1/2023 Immigration and Naturalization Service OMB No. 1115-0053 APPLICATION FOR STATUS AS PERMANENT RESIDENT Approval Expires 8-85 FEE STAMP File No. 436 780 APPLICATION FOR THE BENEFITS OF SECTION: Sec. 209(b), I&N Act Sec. 245, I&N Act See. 214(d). I&N Act Sec. 249, I&N Act Sec. 18, Act of 9/11/57 (DO NOT WRITE ABOVE THIS LINE.) (SEE INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE FILLING IN APPLICATION. IF YOU NEED MORE SPACE TO ANSWER FULLY ANY QUESTION ON THIS FORM. USE A SEPARATE SHEET AND IDENTIFY EACH ANSWER WITH THE NUMBER OF THE CORRESPONDING QUESTION. FILL IN WITH TYPEWRITER OR PRINT IN BLOCK LETTERS IN INK.) 1. I hereby apply for the status of a lawful permanent resident alien on the following basis: (Check one of the boxes below.) A. As a person granted asylum under Section 207(a) to whom an immigrant visa is immediately available (Section 209(b), I&N Act). (No fee required.) B. (Sec. 214(d), I&N Act). As a person who entered the U.S. with a visa issued to me as the fiancee or fiance of a U.S. citizen whom I married within 90 days after my entry, or AS a child of such fiancee or fiance C. As a former government official, or as a member of the immediate family of such official (Section 13, Act of September 11, 1957). D. As a person to whom an immigrant visa is immediately available other than one described above (Section 245, I&N Act). E. As a person who has resided in the United States continuously since prior to July 1, 1924 (Section 249, I&N Act). F. As a person who has resided in the United States continuously since a date on or after July 1. 1924, but before June 30, 1948 (Section 249, I&N Act). G. As a motion to reopen or to reconsider my case in deportation proceedings before an immigration judge. (The fee for this request is $50.00.) 2. My name is (family in capital letters) (First Given) (Middle) 3. Sex Phone number LIU, Chen Male Female (818)882-0323 4. I reside in the United States at: (c/o) (Apt. No.) (No. and Street) 20720 Community St. Canoga Park, Ca. (City) (State) (ZIP Code) 5. Have you ever applied before for permanent resident Canoga Park, Ca. 91306 status in the U.S.? No Yes 6. My file number A- 27436780 7. I am a citizen of (Country) 8. Date of Birth (If "Yes", give the date and place of filing and final disposition.) Taiwan (Month) (Day) (Year) 11-16-11 10-29-84 New Orlean, LA. 9. Place of Birth (City or Town) (County, Province, or State) (Country) Shong-Chen, Honan, China No Response VPoNLy. 10. Name as appears on nonimmigrant document (Form I-94) LIU, Chen I last arrived in the United States at the port of (City and State) on (Month) (Day) (Year) by (Name of vessel or other means of travel) Los Angeles 5-30-85 CAL as a (visitor, student, crewman, parolee, etc.) Visitor I was was not inspected. 11. My nonimmigrant visa, number 018344 was issued by the on (Month) (Day) (Year) United States Consul (Country) 12. I am single married A.I.T. -Hanglong 5-24-85 divorced widowed 13. I have been married one times, including my present marriage, if nov. married. (If you are now married give the following:) a. Number of times my husband or wife has been married one b. Name of husband or wife (Wife give maiden name) Pan, Jui-Fen c. My husband or wife resides with me apart from me at Address (Apt. No.) No. & Street) (Town or City) (Province or State) (Country) 14. I have a. 5 sons or daughters as follows: (Complete all columns as to each son or daughter; if living with you state "with me" in last column: otherwise give city and state or country of son's or daughter's residence). Name Sex Place of Birth Date of Birth Now living at LIU, Hsing-Sheng (Mike) M China 9-21-37 U.S.A. LIU, Ping-Sheng M China 3-6-46 Taiwan FOIA (b)(6) (MENT AUTHORIZED v. members or my rammy are also applying for permanent resident status: LIU, Ping-Sheng DATE: 6-7-85 LOS FOIA (b)(6) acthiclys CR AC SIGNATURE IE DOOVER Form I-485 (Rev. 5-5-83) N RECEIVED TRANS N A 22.436 KETH TRANS TIP 780 COMPLETED
